document.docTitle: Lycopus longissimus Tang & Li 2010, sp. nov.

figureCitation.captionText-0: FIGURES 20 A–D. Lycopus longissimus sp. nov., male holotype from Wuzhishan Mountains. A Male habitus, dorsal; B–D Male palp (B Prolateral, C Ventral, D Retrolateral). Scale bars: A = 1.0 mm, B–D = 0.1 mm.
figureCitation.captionText-1: FIGURES 21 A–E. Lycopus longissimus sp. nov., female paratypes from Wuzhishan Mountains. A Female habitus, dorsal; B, D Epigynum, ventral view; C, E Vulva, dorsal view. Scale bars: A = 1.0 mm, B–E = 0.1 mm.
figureCitation.captionText-2: FIGURES 22 A–E. Lycopus longissimus sp. nov. A–B Male palp (A Ventral, B Retrolateral); C Epigynum, ventral view; D–E Vulva (D Dorsal; E Ventral). Scale bars: A–E = 0.1 mm.

Other material examined.
China :

16 May 1977
, M . B
.
Gu ( IZCAS )
.

Etymology. The specific epithet is taken from the Latin adjective
longissimus
, and means very long, referring to the slender embolus and copulatory ducts.

Diagnosis. This new species is similar to
L. primus Tang & Li, 2009
, but can be distinguished by the much slender embolus, which has a ratio of 2.0 for the length of embolus/circumference (1.0 in
L. primus
).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 20 A–D.
Lycopus longissimus
sp. nov. ,
male holotype from Wuzhishan Mountains. A Male habitus, dorsal; B–D Male palp (B Prolateral, C Ventral, D Retrolateral). Scale bars: A = 1.0 mm, B–D = 0.1 mm.

FIGURES 21 A–E.
Lycopus longissimus
sp. nov. ,
female paratypes from Wuzhishan Mountains. A Female habitus, dorsal; B, D Epigynum , ventral view; C, E Vulva, dorsal view. Scale bars: A = 1.0 mm, B–E = 0.1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Description. Male ( holotype measured): Total length 4.90. Prosoma 1.90 long, 1.70 wide; opisthosoma 3.10 long, 1.70 wide. Prosoma slightly convex, yellow, with sparse setae and small red spots. Tubercle of ALE and PLE grayish white, large and continuous. A white stripe connects with both of ALE. Eye measurements: AME 0.08; ALE 0.12; PME 0.06; PLE 0.11; AME–AME 0.14; AME–ALE 0.18; PME–PME 0.18; PME– PLE 0.42. MOA length 0.37 with front width 0.30 and back width 0.30. Chelicerae, gnathocoxae, labium and sternum yellow. Legs yellow with many spines; femora and metatarsi of I, II red. Leg spination: femur I prolateral 0-0-1-1-1, I–II dorsal 1-1-1-1-1, III–IV dorsal 1-1-1-1; patella I–IV, pro- and retrolateral 1, dorsal 1(distal); tibia I–II dorsal 1-0-1-1, pro- and retrolateral 1-1-1, ventral 2-2-2-2-2, III–IV dorsal, pro- and retrolateral 1-1; metatarsus I–II pro- and retrolateral 1-1-1, ventral 2-2-2-2, III–IV, pro- and retrolateral 1-1, ventral 2-2. Leg formula: 1243; leg measurements: I: 9.70 (2.70, 3.70, 2.30, 1.00); II: 9.50 (2.70, 3.50, 2.30, 1.00); III: 5.10 (1.60, 2.00, 0.90, 0.60); IV: 5.70 (2.00, 1.80, 1.20, 0.70). Opisthosoma dorsum yellow, with red spots anteriorly and 4 pairs of black stripes posteriorly, venter yellow.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 22 A–E.
Lycopus longissimus
sp. nov.
A–B Male palp (A Ventral, B Retrolateral); C Epigynum , ventral view; D–E Vulva (D Dorsal; E Ventral). Scale bars: A–E = 0.1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Palp ( Figs 20 B–D , 22 A–B ). Palpal VTA lamelliform, RTA bifid distally; bulb flat; embolus slender, twisted around the tegulum in two circles.

Female (measurements of one paratype ): Total length 5.00. Prosoma 1.80 long, 1.75 wide. Opisthosoma 3.30 long, 1.70 wide. Eye measurements: AME 0.07; ALE 0.12; PME 0.06; PLE 0.11; AME–AME 0.18; AME–ALE 0.20; PME–PME 0.32; PME–PLE 0.24. MOA length 0.36 with front width 0.32 and back width 0.34. Legs yellow, spines of legs weaker than in male. Spination: Femur I prolateral 1-1-1, dorsal 1–III dorsal 1-1, IV dorsal 1-1-0-1 (left), 1-1-1-1-0-1 (right); tibia I–II dorsal (weak) 1-1, pro- and retrolateral 1-1-1, ventral 2-2-2-2-2; metatarsus I–II pro- and retrolateral 1-1-1, ventral 2-2-2-2-2. Leg formula: 1243; leg measurements: I: 7.40 (2.20, 2.80, 1.60, 0.80); II: 7.30 (2.20, 2.70, 1.60, 0.80); III: 3.90 (1.30, 1.40, 0.70, 0.50); IV: 4.40 (1.50, 1.50, 0.80, 0.60).

Epigynum
( Figs 21 B–E , 22 C–E ). Epigynum with a small hood anteriorly; copulatory openings slitshaped; copulatory ducts slender, twisted, complicated, with almost translucent anterior part; spermathecae short, slightly thicker than copulatory ducts.
Variations. Total length, male: 4.60–5.00 (n=25). Female: 4.90–5.40 (n=54). Some specimens without stripes on dorsal abdomen, copulatory ducts various in the twisted style in different specimens.
